Author: m_c_re
Text: i definitely won't give advice on how to not eat, if that's what you're looking for. but if you're trying to get into a healthier and more regular eating regimen, you can replace the control urges with new rules for yourself that are more productive â€“ like a rule i used during a recovery period a while ago is that at every meal i have to eat protein, and i have to eat something with healthy fat at least once a day, and i have to eat veggies at least once a day. so with rules like that, foods like hummus and avocado and chicken are really excellent, plus they're just good in general. plus, they help you stay full longer so you don't snack, which makes you feel out of control and can lead you to fall back into disordered habits.
